channel.title: Ted Cruz
channel.description: Ted Cruz Texas Candidate for U.S. Senate (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Good evening. I have the honor of standing before you this evening for one reason, because thousands upon thousands of grassroots activists stood united, not for a candidate, but for the sake of restoring liberty. Accountability, quite rightly, rests firmly in the hands of "We the People."
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Since 2010, something extraordinary has been happening, something that has dumbfounded the chattering class.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It began here in Florida in 2010. In Utah, Kentucky, Pennsylvania.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Was repeated this summer in Indiana. Nebraska. Wisconsin.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: And this past month, in the Lone Star State, Texas.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: What is happening all across America is a Great Awakening.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: A response to career politicians in both parties who've gotten us into this mess.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: This national movement is fueled by what unites us: a love of liberty, a belief in the unlimited potential of free men and women.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: I want to tell you a love story. It's the story of all of us, a love story of freedom.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of our Founding Fathers, who fought and bled for freedom and then crafted the most miraculous political document ever conceived, our Constitution. The Framers understood that our rights come, not from monarchs, but from God--and that those rights are secure only when government power is restrained. This love story is the story of the brave Texans in the City of Gonzales. When General Santa Anna demanded that they give up their guns and the cannon that guarded the city, they responded with the immortal cry "Come and take it."
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of the greatest generation of Americans, who rose up to confront the grotesque evil that was the Nazis, and ushered in the greatest era of peace and prosperity the world has ever seen.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of civil-rights heroes, like Dr. Martin Luther King, who stood strong against the scourge of discrimination, and bravely championed that every man and woman should be judged, not by the color of our skin, but by the content of our character.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of President Ronald Reagan, who turned back the creeping growth of government and restored Morning in America. Who spoke out against the oppressive evil of communism and demanded "Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall."
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of my Mom. Irish and Italian, working class, the first in her family to go to college ­ a pioneering mathematician and computer programmer in the 1950s.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of my Dad, who was imprisoned and tortured in Cuba, beaten nearly to death. He fled to Texas in 1957, not speaking English, with $100 sewn into his underwear. He washed dishes making 50 cents an hour to pay his way through the University of Texas, and to start a small business in the oil and gas industry.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: My father is here tonight. When he came to America, él no tenía nada, pero tenía corazón. He had nothing, but he had heart. A heart for freedom. Thank you, Dad.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's the story of each and every one of you. We are all sons and daughters of those who risked everything for freedom, and we have the duty to pass that same opportunity to the generations to follow.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: And yet today, many in Washington seem content to saddle our children with a financial debt larger than our nation has ever seen.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Government is out of control, and we're going broke.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: But I'm here with a word of encouragement. Millions of Americans are standing up, saying we want our country back. Republicans, Democrats, and independents. We will not follow the path of Greece; we will not go quietly into the night.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: This election presents a stark choice. Two visions: we can continue down the road of the Obama Democrats, towards more and more spending, debt and government control of the economy and our lives. Or we can return to the founding principles of our nation--free markets, fiscal responsibility, and individual liberty.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Unfortunately, President Obama's campaign is going to try to divide America. They're going to try to separate us into little groups, and try to scare everybody. They're going to tell seniors that Medicare will be taken away, tell Hispanics that we're not welcome here and send the Vice President to preach a message of division.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: It's sad, how far we've come from hope and change.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: All of this is designed to distract from the real issues that matter. Twenty-three million Americans struggling for work. Sixteen trillion dollars in national debt. Government takeovers of healthcare, of financial services and many aspects of our economy.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Imagine, for a moment, if someone surreptitiously charged hundreds of thousands of dollars on your credit cards, saddling your kids with debts they could never escape.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: That's exactly the impact of this administration's misguided policies. Heidi and I are blessed with two little girls, Caroline and Catherine, 4 and 1. When Caroline was born, our national debt was $10 trillion. Today, as the debt clock shows, it's $16 trillion, larger than our gross domestic product.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: How do we turn things around? How do we get America back to work? President Obama thinks the answer is more and more government.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Government is not the answer. You are not doing anyone a favor by creating dependency, destroying individual responsibility.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Fifty-five years ago, when my dad was a penniless teenage immigrant, thank God some well- meaning bureaucrat didn't put his arm around him and say let me take care of you. Let me give you a government check and make you dependent on government. And by the way, don't bother learning English. That would have been the most destructive thing anyone could have done.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Instead, my parents worked together to start a small business, to provide for their family and to chart their own future. That's the American dream, and Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan understand that.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Under President Obama, 23 million Americans are struggling for work. Hispanic unemployment has risen to over 10 percent; African-American unemployment is over 14 percent. This is tragic. And here I want to say something especially to the Democrats who are listening tonight. You can send a wake-up message to your party--the party that was once proud to be the party of working people. Obama's policies have failed.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Jobs don't come from government; they come from entrepreneurs and small businesses. Two thirds of all new jobs come from small business, and 2.3 million Hispanics own small businesses and yet this Administration has imposed higher taxes and crushing regulations on small businesses across our nation.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: To restore America, to get Americans back to work, we must rein in the leviathan. We must stop spending money we don't have and turn around our crushing debt.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Each of you comprises the fabric of our nation. Together, we must revive our many-century love story with liberty and restore that shining City on a Hill that is America.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: I'd like to close with asking you a few questions, with apologies to Barack Obama.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Can we restore the Constitution?
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Yes we can.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Can we retake the U.S. Senate?
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Can we repeal ObamaCare?
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: And can we defeat President Barack Obama?
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: That, my friends, is change we can believe in.
item.author: Ted Cruz

item.title: Thank you, and God bless America.
item.author: Ted Cruz
